Package remodel.io

Class AbstractReader

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.AbstractReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExpressionReader, ModelReader
public abstract class AbstractReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
AbstractReader is the abstract ancestor of different kinds of parser. It provides common assertions used by several parsers. It initialises the underlying ModelScanner and maintains the last read Token.

AbstractReader implements the Closeable interface, so may be used in try-with-resources blocks, in order to ensure that the AbstractReader and all underlying input streams are closed safely.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractReader

      public AbstractReader​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates an AbstractReader reading input from the given file. Uses the default character encoding UTF-8.
      Parameters:
      file - the input File.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.

    • AbstractReader

      public AbstractReader​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates an AbstractReader reading input from the given file, using the given character encoding. Possible encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16 or ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1).
      Parameters:
      file - the input File.
      encoding - the expected character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.

    • getSettings

      public Settings getSettings()
      Returns the Settings used by this AbstractReader. The Settings configures the Java directory and package names for compiled objects.
      Returns:
      the Settings.
